events.comment: * Initial Player properties

* Rotation of the main Camera and Hitboxes; when <0 or >360, use a modulus formula to get back in a range of 360°

*** World rotation Angles = 0° is North, 90° East, 180° South, 270° West ***

* Set game FOV, modifiable by actions such as ADS; engine FOV seems to be Vertical, and default is 78 which should be "step_B2"0 on Horizontal. Still need to figure that out
---
https://themetalmuncher.github.io/fov-calc/
* Impede movement while changing levels
* Cast a blob shadow under the Player
* Reset the Player position if it goes out of bounds
* This property determines the height of the player camera, so it can be altered for different player states such as crouching, falling from great distances etc.
* Start by defining that the Player is alive
* Jump recover from great heights; "fallOutput" follows the formula y=mx+b
* Crouching
* Debug

parameters: player_eyeLevel + NewLine() + ToString(round(player_hitbox.PhysicsCharacter3D::CurrentFallSpeed())) + NewLine() + player_hitbox.player_isFallingHigh + NewLine() + player_hitbox.player_fallOutput

events.comment: * Press SHIFT to toggle a Sprinting state. The Player gains a higher movement speed and consumes Stamina
* Define the amount of Stamina that the Player has at the start
Define the Sprint state; activate only when the Player has Stamina, impedes shooting
* If the Player is out of Stamina, the Sprint stops and a timer starts
Out of stamina for 3 secs
Timer is done, delete it and set Sprint back to default
Clamp the Player Stamina value between 0 and 100
* Hold CTRL to Crouch. This allows to move under obstacles, and combined with Jumping it allows to reach higher heights

* Swap two different Hitbox models with the "player_isCrouching" variable.

** It's a mess, but it seems it's not possible to change the Height of the Hitbox on a behavior side at this time, so it's the only way to make it work
* Set Stance to true, all its behaviours are activated
* Regain the momentum of the other state
* Deactivate the Mapper behavior from the other State
* Swap the Stance here: set the new one on the position of the other

* Set the other one away from the area: move a dummy platform where the Hitbox will stand, takes the same X/Y positions and sets a big Z offset

** ...It's really, really, really dumb - But doing it this way it allows to maintain the crouching momentum for crouch-jumping, so... yeah.
* Sets the Player Camera to the new position, taking in mind also the Eyelevel property
* Repeat for Crouching
* When near a Physics Object, it allows to grab it and throw it/release it
* Debug
* "interact_interruptShoot" is a timer linked to the Interact function. When throwing an Object, it doesn't allow to shoot simultanely
* Object is in front of you, grab it with Interact key
* wtf

MAIN GRAB FUNCTION

* One for standing, one for crouching

* Really should be fixed to just one function...
* Place the Pivot point of the Physics Object, which determines the trajectory of the launch
* Define Player Strength for throwing different Objects

Throw

* Formula is normalized vectors * strength, defined by any different objects

 / Exit SM
* Also controls the visibility of the Player Hitbox. Detach them
Set regenerating health if true

Camera shake properties
Shake camera when hit

Player is dead
Swap the two camera objects
Activate the behaviors
Apply a small physics force and random rotation
